<|begin_of_text|>Which VPN service stands out as the optimal choice for ensuring top-notch online privacy and security according to your experience? We've asked our readers to weigh in and share their thoughts, with the top results displayed below.
Last year, we asked readers for their opinion on which VPN service they use, and which one they'd recommend to others. The two services with the highest number of votes were ExpressVPN and NordVPN, and after a lengthy back-and-forth discussion in the comments section, a winner was ultimately crowned: NordVPN, by a very close margin.
That was one year ago, and times have changed quite a bit since then. For starters, the coronavirus outbreak forced millions of workers to shift their attention to working from home, which in turn led to a surge in VPN usage in an effort to bypass corporate firewalls.
At the same time, new privacy and security concerns continue to arise as well, which means that VPNs will likely remain relevant for quite a while.
We've received some interesting feedback from our readers on this topic, including a new poll where we asked which service they'd recommend to friends or family. NordVPN was once again crowned as the winner (with NordVPN 2020 being one of the leading VPN services this year), but ExpressVPN was just 1 vote away from taking first place as well. Overall, these two services received 70 percent of the total votes, and it's hard to argue with the fact that these two VPNs are the two best services in the business.
Below, we've rounded up our top picks in this poll based on the number of votes received, along with a few comments from our readers.
The best VPNs
NordVPN (Winner) - 56 votes
NordVPN is the winner in this year's vote, beating out ExpressVPN by a margin of 1 vote. Readers say that NordVPN is very easy to use, has great connection speeds, and is the most reliable service for Netflix streaming.
"I have NordVPN on my router. I've had 0 issues with it. I have friends that have been using Nord for over 2 years with no issues at all."
ExpressVPN - 55 votes
ExpressVPN comes in second place, and is very close behind NordVPN. Readers say that ExpressVPN is the best overall VPN service for both beginners and advanced users. Additionally, it works very well with streaming services, and is compatible with many popular operating systems.
"I use ExpressVPN and it is a fantastic service. I have been using it for years with no issues at all. It is very easy to use. I highly recommend this service."

<|begin_of_text|>Which VPN service stands out as the optimal choice for ensuring top-notch online privacy and security according to your experience? Why is it the most reliable one? We all understand how vital it is to keep safe when browsing the web, but choosing the most suitable service may seem overwhelming due to the variety of options available. With that in mind, we’ll be breaking down the most important features you should consider when choosing a reliable VPN service. 
1. Fast Connection Speed
If you don’t want your browsing experience to be bogged down by slow and unstable connections, you’ll want to make sure that the VPN you choose supports servers that provide top-notch speeds. You can verify this through speed tests that determine the actual connection speed of a VPN server, which should be much faster than what your connection speed was without a VPN. 
2. Strong Encryption
The encryption capabilities of a VPN are one of the most crucial factors you should look for. This determines the overall level of security and privacy protection offered by a VPN. The stronger the encryption, the better. 
3. Variety of Features
Other notable features that you’ll want to consider are a kill switch, which automatically disconnects your internet connection if the VPN connection drops, and split tunneling, which lets you choose which traffic to route through the VPN server.
4. User-Friendly Interface
A user-friendly interface that is easy to navigate and manage is essential for novice VPN users, as it can help them avoid any potential pitfalls or issues when setting up the VPN or configuring the settings. 
5. Privacy and Security
When choosing a VPN, it’s important to ensure that the service offers a secure connection with advanced security features, including a kill switch, DNS leak protection, and no-logs policies. A VPN should also have a strong encryption algorithm to protect your data from prying eyes.
6. Strong Reputation
Another factor to consider is the reputation of the VPN provider. Look for reliable reviews from trusted sources, and ensure that the company has a proven track record of delivering top-notch service. 
7. Jurisdiction
The jurisdiction of the VPN provider is also important. VPN providers in countries with strict data retention laws can be a source of concern due to the potential for law enforcement agencies to access the provider’s logs. 
8. Streaming Capabilities
For users who want to access streaming services from a country other than their own, VPNs are essential. Make sure to check if the VPN service supports streaming platforms such as Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime Video.
9. Device Compatibility
When it comes to VPNs, device compatibility is essential. Make sure that the service you choose is compatible with the devices you use, whether it’s your PC, Mac, smartphone, tablet, or router.
10. Customer Support
Finally, you’ll want to look for VPN providers that offer excellent customer support. A VPN service should provide 24/7 support via live chat, email, or phone to help you troubleshoot any issues you may encounter.
11. Free Trials or Money-Back Guarantee
Free trials or money-back guarantees are another important factor to consider when choosing a VPN. If a VPN service provides these options, you can test out the service before making a commitment and ensure that it’s the right fit for you.
12. Pricing and Value for Money
Last but not least, price is also a crucial factor. It’s important to find a VPN service that provides the best value for your money, with a reasonable price point that fits your budget. 
In conclusion, a reliable VPN service is essential for protecting your online privacy and security, and it’s important to choose the one that best fits your needs. Consider the factors we’ve outlined, and take the time to research different VPN services to find the one that’s right for you. With the right VPN service, you can surf the internet safely and securely, without worrying about hackers or third-party tracking.<|end_of_text|>

<|begin_of_text|>Which VPN service stands out as the optimal choice for ensuring top-notch online privacy and security according to your experience? We need to know because that’s what we’re here for. That’s right, we’re here to give you the heads-up about what’s going on in the VPN industry to ensure that you stay safe online at all times. You need to know what VPN provider gives you the best overall performance and the best possible features in order to make a smart decision that would benefit you greatly in the long run. And that’s where our comparison tables come in. So if you’re wondering which VPN provider you should be using in order to ensure that you get the most for your money and that you enjoy the most efficient VPN service possible, you’ve come to the right place.
First off, let’s define VPN. A VPN or a Virtual Private Network, is essentially a secure and encrypted connection between two or more devices that are connected to the internet. VPNs are usually used for connecting offices, which usually use different networks, in order to connect them to each other. VPNs usually use special software or hardware to create the aforementioned secure connections. In a nutshell, a VPN connects multiple devices through a private connection that goes through an unsecured network, in this case the internet. By using a VPN, people and businesses alike can create a secure environment for their data and their online connections.
VPN technology is quite widespread. It’s basically the foundation of the internet itself. It’s one of the reasons why the internet is so useful and so effective as a communication tool. Without VPN technology, the internet as we know it wouldn’t be as widely used and as effective as it is. That said, VPNs can be used to connect various devices and even offices in order to improve the efficiency of any internet connection, especially when connecting to public WiFi hotspots or any other unsecured network. But VPNs can also be used to protect our privacy online and to access content that’s usually not available in our region. So it’s not just a corporate tool but it can be a useful tool for protecting our privacy online. And that’s why VPNs are so popular.
That said, how can we make sure that the VPN service we’re using is truly safe? The truth is that there are a lot of VPN providers out there, and not all of them are safe and effective. A lot of VPN providers out there are just interested in making a profit and don’t really care about the quality of their service. So how do we make sure that the VPN service we’re using is truly safe and secure? Well, the first thing you need to do is to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering is reputable and reliable. You need to do some research on them to see what other people are saying about them, how long they’ve been in business, and so on. You need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering is well-known and that it has a good reputation in the industry.
That said, another thing you need to look for in a VPN provider is a no-logs policy. You need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering doesn’t keep any logs of your online activity, and that it doesn’t keep any logs of what websites you visit, what search terms you use, and so on. And you also need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering doesn’t keep any logs of your connection data, such as your IP address and the websites you visit.
A VPN provider that keeps no logs of your online activity and your connection data is called a “zero-log” VPN provider. A zero-log VPN provider doesn’t keep any logs of your online activity or your connection data, and that means that your online activity and your connection data are completely private. So if you’re looking for a VPN provider that offers a zero-log policy, you need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering offers a true zero-log policy and that it doesn’t keep any logs of your online activity or your connection data.
You also need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering offers a high level of encryption. A VPN provider that offers a high level of encryption is called an “advanced encryption” VPN provider. An advanced encryption VPN provider uses strong encryption algorithms, such as AES-256, in order to protect your online activity and your connection data. So if you’re looking for a VPN provider that offers advanced encryption, you need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering offers a true advanced encryption policy.
And finally, you need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering offers a good balance between speed and security. A VPN provider that offers a good balance between speed and security is called an “optimally balanced” VPN provider. An optimally balanced VPN provider offers a good balance between speed and security, and that means that you can enjoy fast internet speeds without sacrificing your online security and privacy.
And that’s it! Those are the main things you need to look for in a VPN provider in order to make sure that you get the best VPN service possible. Of course, there are a lot of other things you need to look for in a VPN provider, but those are the main things you need to look for. So if you want to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering is truly safe and effective, you need to make sure that the VPN provider you’re considering offers a true no-logs policy, a true advanced encryption policy, and a good balance between speed and security.<|end_of_text|>

<|begin_of_text|>Which VPN service stands out as the optimal choice for ensuring top-notch online privacy and security according to your experience? Let’s have a look at the top-rated VPNs for 2020.
ExpressVPN has been a leader in the VPN market for a while now. The reason behind this success is that it does its job extremely well and is extremely user-friendly. The company has data centers in 94 countries and is currently operating over 3000 servers. Its main servers are in the US, UK, and Canada. However, the server network is continuously growing.
While most VPNs limit the speed to prevent traffic congestion on servers, ExpressVPN has a speed of 84 Mbps which is very fast. ExpressVPN is compatible with many platforms such as Windows, Mac OS X, iOS, Android, Chrome, Firefox, etc. It has also developed applications for streaming, Kodi, and routers.
In addition to all these qualities, it provides you with 24/7 live chat support and a 30-day money-back guarantee.
While many people do not use a VPN because they think it is slow, NordVPN is here to change that perception. It offers a download speed of 65 Mbps which is very fast and can easily meet your needs. In addition to the good speed, it also has a large server network with more than 5000 servers in 60 different countries. The NordVPN network is spread across all the major cities of the world, which ensures that you can access all the restricted sites in no time. It also provides DNS leak protection so that you do not fall prey to the hackers when you are browsing through the internet.
Besides providing the standard features like VPN protocols, DNS leak protection, kill switch, and strong encryption, it also offers a double VPN facility. You can easily use it in all devices like Mac OS X, Windows, iOS, Android, Linux, Firefox, etc.
The icing on the cake is the 30-day money-back guarantee that the company offers.
While you are browsing through the internet, it is always recommended that you hide your IP address for security reasons. This is because the data is shared with the ISPs which is used for tracking. This is where HideMyAss VPN comes into the picture. It has over 1200 servers in 180 locations that offer the best speed to its users. It has the capability to unblock the restricted websites and offers 24/7 live chat support. Another great feature is the automatic kill switch which will stop all internet connection if it detects any leak. You will not find any leak even when you are surfing on insecure wifi networks.
All in all, HideMyAs comes with a user-friendly interface, a high-quality encryption, and 30-day money-back guarantee.
4. SaferVPN
SaferVPN comes with all the standard features that you expect from a good VPN. It provides a double VPN facility so that your online identity is completely masked. It allows you to connect 5 devices simultaneously and offers a high-speed connection. In addition to these features, SaferVPN offers automatic kill switch, DNS leak protection, strong encryption, and split-tunneling.
SaferVPN can be easily used on multiple platforms such as Android, Windows, Mac OS X, and iOS. The company is headquartered in Israel and offers 24/7 customer support.
CyberGhost has a network of over 2000 servers spread across 60 countries. The servers are located in various continents such as North America, Europe, and Asia. This makes sure that the users can easily access all the restricted websites. In addition to this, it has more than 5000 IPs which make it very user-friendly. All these IPs help in unblocking Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, BBC, and all other blocked websites. In addition to this, it offers a free download option for its Windows and Mac OS X users.
CyberGhost offers features such as automatic kill switch, no-log policy, strong encryption, etc. It has an easy-to-use user interface which ensures that you do not face any technical glitches. All these features come at a cost of $6.99 per month which is a reasonable price.
A VPN is a crucial requirement if you are someone who regularly logs into your favorite online sites, especially those that you want to keep private. The best VPNs for you will provide you with a variety of options in terms of protocols and speeds. It will also have a large network of servers spread across all the major cities of the world. This way, it will be easy for you to access all the restricted websites.

<|begin_of_text|>Which VPN service stands out as the optimal choice for ensuring top-notch online privacy and security according to your experience? I personally have used and have been using many VPNs to find out what the optimal one should look like. This time I will introduce a popular VPN app called PureVPN, which has attracted a large number of users with its rich features and reasonable price. This time I will introduce the highlights of this VPN service.
PureVPN has an excellent privacy policy that is very easy to read and understand. They promise that your information will never be shared with a third party. Although this has been true for many years, it has only recently been made even more detailed to further enhance customer confidence. In addition, it should be noted that PureVPN uses AES-256-GCM encryption to protect your data when connected to the internet, and it uses OpenVPN protocol by default.
You can use this VPN service on almost all major operating systems, including Windows, Mac, Linux, Android, iOS, and Blackberry. You can also use PureVPN on some routers. In addition, PureVPN supports most VPN devices, such as DD-WRT, Asus, Tomato and Linksys. To find out if your device supports PureVPN, you can check the compatibility list on the PureVPN website.
How to use PureVPN?
Using this service is quite simple. When you first download the application, you can log in with your email address and password. After logging in, you will be prompted to select the VPN server you want to connect to. When you have connected to the PureVPN server, you will see that your IP address and location have changed. Your IP address will no longer be the same as your real IP address, and your location will appear to be in the country where the PureVPN server is located.
This service offers a huge list of servers around the world to allow you to connect to the server that best suits your needs. Currently, PureVPN has a server in almost 140 countries around the world. These servers are also very fast. For this reason, you can use PureVPN to access streaming websites such as Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and HBO from anywhere in the world.
PureVPN also offers DNS leak protection. This service will allow you to connect to a VPN server in your chosen country without being blocked by your local ISP. When using PureVPN to access websites that are blocked in your country, you can use the SmartDNS service provided by PureVPN. Using this service, you can access a variety of streaming services that are blocked in your country.
